GID is not necessarily perverse, either. It's not "Oh I want to be a man!" or "Oh I want to be a woman!". It's "Oh, I don't want this inexplicable emotional agony that relentlessly rakes away my soul every waking moment of every day all because my body and my mind do not align with one another!" It's like trying to play a playstation disc on an xbox, or visa versa. It just doesn't know what to do with it. Likewise, neither do we. Ask almost any person with GID, that if offered a pill that miraculously made their gender align with their sex, most would take it - myself included. Because having those two facets of your person aligned, means the pain *goes away*. That's truly what we want, not to trick you or delve into perverse lusts... we just want to stop hurting. That's all. And well, since medical science is not exactly equipped yet to physically rewire a chunk of the brain's interior... the next best thing is to change the outside! Luckily, they've gotten pretty good at that part.

What blessed imaginary country provides free sex changes until adulthood...

I'm trans. And I'm a little perturbed by some of yall's opinions, especially since this is a HENTAI. I mean, c'mon, there is way weirder stuff here. Sooo, perhaps I should answer a few questions. Sex and Gender are not the same thing. Sex is determined by genetic code (most of the time, there are outliers; see 'intersex'). Gender is determined by what hormones are received at what time during fetal development - some of which come from the mother! A specific region of the brain is responsible for a person's gender identity, and while it may sound odd, the 'color' (or darkness/lightness) of this region is the only known way of empirically identifying a person's gender. Unfortunately this region is on the interior of the brain, so only corpses can be identified this way. That's why it's so 'wishy washy' as there's no clear indicator we can see. Just believe the patient. Growing up with GID hurts, a lot.

Opinion Alert.

I believe in personal liberty, you are free to think things however you like. As long as it doesn't cross over my own personal liberty.

Another of my belief is Empirical Truth. Where there is such a thing as absolute truth. 1 + 1 = 2 (for example)

I like gender bend in fiction because i like to imagine thought provoking possibilities. In real life however, I see gender in a biological stand point

It is by definition the goal of every living being(bacteria included) to pass on their genetic material to future generations. Trans people are literally ending a familial line that has span for many generation

Technology has not progressed far enough for a biological male to get pregnant nor a biological female to impregnate. Maybe one day it will be possible, but until then trans people are using crutches not the cure

Unlike real crutches, is it impossible to live without the surgery tho? Is it more meaningful than a pacemaker? Consider plz.

Ted Talk over. Trims n sorry

Nothing gay about this, trans women are women, and as for the age thing on deciding if people are trans, human gender is typically understood and decided on at a young age anyway. No one tells a kid who is assigned female that they need to wait till they're an adult to be sure, so why wait for a trans kid? Irl there is no surgeon or doctor who would prescribe hormones or perform a surgery without serious psych evals and extensive discussions with the child in question to determine if they are seriously trans and healthy and sane enough to undergo treatment, so there is nothing to debate. Let trans people affirm who they are. Most people can't undergo surgery until they're legal adults anyway.

I have absolutely nothing against being trans: you do you, dude. But... between the ages of 13 and 18? That is just fucked... to take that decision so early is just messed up. We have no clue who we really are between the ages of 13 and 18, and this is an irreversible process. Well, maybe it's reversible, but I imagine it costs money to do it a second time if it's possible. Wait, why is it free in the first place? If I'm paying public healthcare tax, I at least want my money to go to something actually important like insulin or cancer treatment. Bottom line: if you wanna be trans, don't do it until your mind and body have fully developed.
